hours._text:
Address:

Brimington Community Centre,
Heywood Street,
Brimington,
Chesterfield,
S43 1DB
(main door on High Street)

Thursdays 2pm to 6.30pm

Warm Hub - free cuppa and biscuit, warm space to have a chat or read the paper.

Brimington Lunch Club - Tuesdays 12pm (noon). Two course home-cooked lunch with hot drink at a small charge of £4 (under 12's £2); followed by a game of bingo.

Contact:

Brimington Parish Council: brimingtonparishcouncil@outlook.com

Address:

Hollingwood Community Room,
‘Open House’,
Laburnam St,
Chesterfield,
S40 4ST

Mondays, 11am to 3pm.

Open to all, warm friendly environment. Serving complimentary hot drinks, biscuits and cake.

Contact details:

Richard Coles
07814557379

Address:

Inkersall Methodist Church (portacabin),
Summerskill Green,
Inkersall,
Chesterfield,
S43 3SR

Tuesdays 9am to 1pm

A free warm space / coffee morning offering hot drinks, biscuits and toasted teacakes.

Contact details:

Jean Metcalfe
01246 476997

Minister Rev. Tracey Harris
tracey.harris@methodist.org.uk

Address:

Staveley Edge Centre,
Staveley Methodist Church,
Chesterfield Road,
S43 3XD

Various activities and services including:

Tuesday afternoon bingo

Thursday afternoon free café (includes debt/housing/benefits advice),

Fortnightly communion meal on a Thursday evening

Monthly autism support group

Opening times:

All opening times will include free tea / coffee, phone charging and biscuits.

Tuesday 1.30 to 3pm
Thursday 12.30 to 3.30pm
Thursday fortnightly 6pm to 7.30pm

Contact details:

Edge Ministries
Steve Martin
steve.martin@edgeministries.net

Address:

St Michael’s & All Angels Church
Church Street
Chesterfield
S43 1JG

Monday:

9am to 11am - Little Mick’s toddler group in church.

12pm to 2pm: Foodbank in church hall.

Tuesday:

10am to 12pm - Bookshop and coffee morning church hall

2pm to 4pm - Safe space in church

Thursday:

9.30am - Holy communion service followed by coffee (even if people just want to come and sit in the heated building they’ll be welcome!)

2pm to 3pm - Ladies group in church hall (predominant aimed at post retirement age women)

Saturday:

10am to 12pm - Bookshop and cafe in church hall. Foodbank support and CAB help available.

Contact details:

Rev Daniel Cooke
01246 273103
Email danielbcooke@hotmail.com

Address:

The Hop Flower
Beeley Close
Inkersall
S43 3EB

Warm space, free hot drink and biscuits.

Monday to Friday, 4pm until late.

Saturday and Sunday, 12pm until late. 

Contact details:

01246 477733

Address:

St Columbus Church
Inkersall Green Road
Inkersall
Staveley
S43 3SE

Wednesdays 10am to 2pm

Warm space, free hot drink and biscuit.

Contact details:

Adrian Arnold
01246 280633
